articles.headline: Liveable Income Guarantee: a rich country can do better
articles.description: The shift of wealth to the wealthier is driving interest in Universal Basic Income and Job Guarantee proposals as millions of Australians are being left behind by Australia's mean welfare system. Can Labor do better? Brian Toohey reports.
articles.author: Brian Toohey

articles.headline: Gucci Handbag: Josh Frydenberg’s JobKeeper gifts to Gucci and Prada
articles.description: Gucci and Prada owe Josh Frydenberg a debt of gratitude. Louis Vuitton is not alone. The Italians got JobKeeper too. Michael West reports as evidence emerges the Treasurer opted to ignore advice regarding a claw-back mechanism to get the money back from profitable companies.
articles.author: Michael West

articles.headline: The Other 9/11: secrecy fight over Australian spies helping CIA overthrow Chile’s President
articles.description: On the eve of it's 48th anniversary, documents just declassified by the Australian National Archives show the extent to which the Australian Secret Intelligence Service (ASIS) worked closely with the CIA in the lead-up to the Coup-d'état in Chile in September 1973. Story by Peter Kornbluh and Clinton Fernandes
articles.author: Kim Wingerei

articles.headline: “Everybody did it”: wealthy doctors lobbies ride JobKeeper gravy train
articles.description: JobKeeper for dentists? Fair enough. But more public subsidies for doctors who enjoyed rising surpluses or hardly suffered a downturn? Callum Foote reports on Australia’s Medical Colleges
articles.author: Callum Foote

articles.headline: Manal Al-Sharif: Australia’s new surveillance laws remind me of home
articles.description: "I left Saudi Arabia, one of the world’s most oppressive regimes. But the Australian Government’s recent draconian rules remind me so much of home." Cyber security expert and human rights luminary Manal Al-Sharif reports on the dangers of the new surveillance laws.
articles.author: Manal al-Sharif

articles.headline: Political Dynamite: JobKeeper for billionaires a campaign wrecker for Morrison, Frydenberg
articles.description: Big business doesn't vote, small business does. That's the dilemma for Scott Morrison and Josh Frydenberg as they strive to keep JobKeeper secret heading into the election. Michael West reports
articles.author: Michael West

articles.headline: Human rights violations now enshrined in legislation – in Australia
articles.description: Last week, the Morrison government, supported by the ALP, passed a law that allows for security agencies, on the most flimsy of pretexts, to access and manipulate the electronic data of any citizen. It continues the slide into authoritarianism that started with the Tampa affair 20 years ago.
articles.author: Greg Barns

articles.headline: The Nouveau Poor – gender pay gap, super inequality stretched in pandemic
articles.description: Sixty one. That’s the additional number of days women currently have to work in a financial year to earn as much as their male counterparts. And when it comes to superannuation, the gender gap gets worse.
articles.author: Harry Chemay

articles.headline: Wollemi Mine? Experts label Barilaro’s plan for new coal “corrupt”, unviable
articles.description: The NSW government is pushing through new coal exploration areas in the state’s mid-west, which have been labelled unviable and “corrupt” by independent experts even as the G7 call a halt on all new coal mining reports Callum Foote
articles.author: Callum Foote

articles.headline: High-End Heist: Josh sells Pauline the dummy, JobKeeper heat rises
articles.description: Treasurer Josh Frydenberg and his big business patrons are in crisis mode amid rising demands to end the JobKeeper cover-up and disclose the transfer of billions to profitable companies. Michael West on the unfolding political drama.
articles.author: Michael West

articles.headline: The Doherty Trade-Off: experts plead for a sensible “Freedom Day”
articles.description: Experts warn against open slather on "Freedom Day", pointing to the high mortality rate in the UK, as Prime Minister Scott Morrison and NSW Premier Gladys Berejiklian prepare to pull back public health measures and end lockdowns. Callum Foote talks with public health experts on the Doherty Report assumptions and the cost of opening up.
articles.author: Callum Foote

articles.headline: High Court ruling on Facebook comments a high risk for publishers; high time for reform
articles.description: In its recent ruling the High Court decreed that commercial publishers have responsibility for comments made on their Facebook pages. In the absence of a 21st century legal framework covering this newfangled thing called the Internet, the Court's reasoning for the ruling refers in part to case-law dating back to the 19th century.
articles.author: Kim Wingerei

articles.headline: That Fella Down Under! Scott Morrison’s AUKUS deal designed to win election, not make Australia safe
articles.description: Strap in for a media blitz on the threat from China. Prime Minister #ThatFellaDownUnder Scott Morrison and his merry band are about to take a war to the election. Michael West reports.
articles.author: Michael West

articles.headline: Privacy is a one way street with this Government
articles.author: Michael West

articles.headline: Will jobkeeper rorts bring down the government?
articles.author: Michael West

articles.headline: Greedy Pharmacy Guild: another coven of lobbyists collects JobKeeper
articles.description: The powerful Pharmacy Guild of Australia, despite its members' record profits, and admitting Covid-19 did not harm their business one bit, has pocketed JobKeeper.
articles.author: Callum Foote

articles.headline: J’Adore Josh: not just Gucci and Louis Vuitton, Cartier and Burberry got JobKeeper too
articles.description: The high fashion house which counts Cartier and Piaget among its brands, took JobKeeper, enjoyed a sterling rise in profits and gave local executives a pay rise while their Luxembourg parent, Richemont, helped itself to dividends.
articles.author: Michael West

articles.headline: Upsetting the neighbours: the high cost of Australia’s nuclear submarine “deal”
articles.description: Buying ludicrously expensive nuclear submarines upsets our neighbours, inflates the defence budget, unbalances our military forces and does nothing to address the bigger security threat of global warming and species extinction writes Brian Toohey.
articles.author: Brian Toohey

articles.headline: MWM PODCAST – Craig Reucassel & Christiaan Van Vuuren: ‘BIG DEAL’
articles.description: To see the film go to https://www.makeitabigdeal.org Audio version of the podcast will be available on Spotify and Apple Podcasts...
articles.author: Michael West

articles.headline: Uppercut: KPMG cheating scandal mirrors Big Four rot, business leadership
articles.description: Revelations of rampant cheating at KPMG echo the broader decay in culture at the top of business in Australia; at the Big Four firms which advise both our largest corporations and government, indeed the firms to which government itself is being outsourced. Michael West speaks with Jeffrey Knapp.
articles.author: Michael West

articles.headline: Has PM put Australia on the hook to finance struggling UK, US submarine projects?
articles.description: "Almost comical". Experts lambast Scott Morrison's "crazy" AUKUS deal to buy nuclear submarine tech from parlous UK and US programs. Marcus Reubenstein looks at the state of the submarine sector.
articles.author: Marcus Reubenstein

articles.headline: The Big Ten Donors: property developers ratchet up their spending on politicians
articles.description: Research from the Centre for Public Integrity has shown that over the past 20 years, the property and construction sectors have disclosed a total of over $54 million in donations to political parties.
articles.author: Callum Foote

articles.headline: What will the donors think? Liberal/Labor refuse to act without nod from Big Gas
articles.description: Labor claims it’s a safety issue, Liberals say it’s a drafting issue. The bigger issue is how both major political parties have capitulated to the oil and gas industry again, this time voting to keep offshore petroleum production data secret
articles.author: Callum Foote

articles.headline: “Voices Of” ignites 30 independent movements across Australia
articles.description: The "Voices Of" movement is gathering steam as more than 30 independent groups seek to field candidates at the next Federal election. Kim Wingerei reports on the new force for political disruption.
articles.author: Kim Wingerei

articles.headline: Ken Henry: The interests of the most disadvantaged are not being served by our tax system
articles.description: Those who care about distributive justice cannot ignore the extraordinary intergenerational inequity inherent in our present tax system. I am...
articles.author: Pearls and Irritations

articles.headline: In competition between China and the US, Australian consumers choose China
articles.description: Australia’s relationship with China involves many dimensions and Australia/China relations look a lot different from different perspectives.  Clearly the relationship...
articles.author: Pearls and Irritations

articles.headline: $66 Billion Reasons: did Scott Morrison get the French submarines right?
articles.description: When Tony Abbott famously reintroduced knights and dames, few could have fathomed how far this government - with its retro policy bent and its tugging of the imperial forelock - could have turned back time. We now know. Michael West investigates AUKUS and whether Scott Morrison made the right call on French submarines.
articles.author: Michael West

articles.headline: Whither the WestConnex cash? Berejiklian buries tracks on Transurban’s $11bn toll road windfall
articles.description: Just how good is the WestConnex mega-deal which the toll road monopolist Transurban has struck with NSW? Where is the new $11b going and what is this mysterious new "WestInvest"? Wendy Bacon investigates the deception around Australia's biggest and most secretive infrastructure project.
articles.author: Wendy Bacon

articles.headline: Crossword clues and bullying – the influence of Australia’s pro-Israel lobby unveiled
articles.description: The intimidating influence of Australia's pro-Israel lobby does not only limit what mainstream media outlets dare publish, it forces self-censorship on editors and journalists alike, writes John Lyons in his latest book - Dateline Jerusalem: Journalism's toughest assignment
articles.author: Kim Wingerei

articles.headline: Freedom from Information: thank you Gladys Berejiklian and NSW Health
articles.description: Dear Premier Gladys Berejiklian and NSW Health, thank you for finally responding to our Freedom of Information request. We ask that, in future, you simply send us an old roll of toilet paper.
articles.author: Callum Foote

articles.headline: Smiles for Frydenberg and Birmingham, but not for those on JobSeeker
articles.description: The punishment for Australia’s lowest income workers continues with the announcement that Covid disaster payments will end once the states hit the vaccination goals laid out in the Doherty Institute’s modelling.
articles.author: Dechlan Brennan

articles.headline: Beyond the Spin: workers’ share of wealth slumps to record low
articles.description: Workers now have the lowest share ever of the nation’s earnings. Under-employment is even worse now than it was late last year. Alan Austin looks behind the spin to report the true state of unemployment and economic management in Australia
articles.author: Alan Austin

articles.headline: Grave Concerns: Catholic bid for cemeteries finds champion in new premier Perrottet
articles.description: The ascension of Dominic Perrottet to Premier of NSW comes at a critical hour in the campaign by the Catholic Church to control NSW cemeteries for the next 200 years.
articles.author: Callum Foote

articles.headline: Playing the victim while the mainstream media runs protection racket
articles.author: Michael West

articles.headline: Gladys is gone but her secrets remain
articles.description: Whither the WestConnex cash? Berejiklian buries tracks on Transurban’s $11bn toll road windfall
articles.author: Michael West

articles.headline: Planned obsolescence – how Big Tech manipulates consumers to spend again and again
articles.description: "Your smartphone has a built-in frailty that will force it to fail in approximately 2-3 years." Manal al-Sharif reports on how Big Tech designs products to fail
articles.author: Manal al-Sharif

articles.headline: Pandora Papers: is the world’s biggest leak the world’s biggest cover-up?
articles.description: Where are the US billionaires, the Wall Streeters, the Big Four tax firms Deloitte, EY, KPMG, PwC? Michael West explores the mystery of the Pandora Papers in this first of a two-part series.
articles.author: Michael West

articles.headline: Profits over People: in-home care a cash bonanza for greedy aged providers
articles.description: A $53,000 home-care package gets just nine hours of support yet the government has slung suppliers an extra $6.5bn. Dr Sarah Russell reports on aged care profiteers and finds self-management is the answer
articles.author: Dr Sarah Russell

articles.headline: Billionaire disrupters: Forrest, Ambani’s new energy onslaught leaves carbon-corrupt politicians in the dust
articles.description: Andrew Forrest and Mukesh Ambani, the richest men in India and Australia respectively, have just gone public with renewable energy deals on a scale previously unthinkable.
articles.author: Tim Buckley

articles.headline: Reds Under Bed: Barnaby and Keith’s plot for Australia to subsidise China
articles.description: The Coalition’s election war-chest will be brimming with fossil fuel donations thanks to demands by Barnaby Joyce and Keith Pitt to transfer $250bn from Australia to Chinese and other coal and gas companies. Michael West reports on the National Party's latest brainstorm
articles.author: Michael West

articles.headline: Pandora Papers reveal world’s Tax Avoidance B-Team. Where’s the A-Team?
articles.author: Michael West

articles.headline: BratKeeper: profitable private schools purloin JobKeeper, pandemic payments too
articles.description: Blessed are the rich, for theirs is the tax from the poor! Elite private schools gorged themselves on JobKeeper despite their profits, on top of Pandemic stimulus payments, and as well as trousering a bigger slice of the federal funding pie
articles.author: Trevor Cobbold

articles.headline: Business whispers: how Treasurer Josh Frydenberg squandered $40bn on JobKeeper
articles.description: It turns out the very business lobbyists who stood to benefit most from JobKeeper were regularly advising the Government on JobKeeper. How $40bn was squandered and the role of corporate spinners Business Council of Australia and AI Group.
articles.author: Callum Foote

articles.headline: Britain’s Guantanamo: is Julian Assange a terrorist?
articles.description: As Julian Assange prepares to face a British court for possibly the last time, Gary Lord explores the bizarre twists in the US effort to extradite the Wikileaks founder and the silence of global media.
articles.author: Gary Lord

articles.headline: Gladys and the Wagga Wagga Gun Club: What’s the Scam?
articles.description: Birds away! Gladys Berejiklian’s former boyfriend Daryl Maguire sure did the Wagga Wagga Gun Club a tidy favour when he jagged it a big government grant. What’s the scam?
articles.author: Michael West

articles.headline: “Clearly Unacceptable”: Environment Minister Sussan Ley bans renewable project, blesses three new coal mines
articles.description: In the tradition of Coalition environment ministers, Sussan Ley has knocked back a large renewable energy project while waving through three new coal mines. Callum Foote reports on a government ministry which has found more renewable projects “clearly unacceptable” than coal mines.
articles.author: Callum Foote

articles.headline: Perrottet invests in Putin not Parramatta
articles.description: Dominic Perrottet’s controversial hedge fund is lending to Russia, China, Saudi Arabia and Cayman Islands. What is the NSW Premier doing funding dictators with NSW taxpayers’ money? Michael West reports on the New Generations Fund.
articles.author: Michael West

articles.headline: Slick dealings: Australia on wrong end of Trump era oil play
articles.description: As Donald Trump would say, nobody does an announcement like Scott Morrison, nobody. Is there any substance to the US oil storage deal which was so praised by the PM and his energy minister Angus Taylor?
articles.author: Jommy Tee

articles.headline: Sussan thinks Renewable Energy is “Clearly Unacceptable”
articles.description: The Story: https://www.michaelwest.com.au/clearly-unacceptable-environment-minister-sussan-ley-bans-renewable-project-blesses-three-new-coal-mines/ Patreon: https://www.patreon.com/TheWestReport Merch: https://lonelykidsclub.com/new/michael+west Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/michaelwest.journo Insta: https://www.instagram.com/michaelwestjourno/
articles.author: Michael West

articles.headline: The “Catholic Cabinet”: Perrottet’s $5bn cemeteries bid dwarfs Gladys’ gun club frolic
articles.description: Dominic Perrottet's five-man "Catholic Cabinet" rushed through a deal to deliver control of Sydney's cemeteries, ergo $5bn in capital, to the Catholic Church, in defiance of independent expert advice. Callum Foote reports
articles.author: Callum Foote

articles.headline: Dutton wants you to pay for MP’s defamation suits!
articles.description: Story: https://www.news.com.au/national/politics/peter-dutton-suggests-publicfunded-legal-fund-for-mps-to-sue-for-defamation/news-story/69ed36299b449a58b0f1abeba886612e Patreon: https://www.patreon.com/TheWestReport Merch: https://lonelykidsclub.com/new/michael+west Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/michaelwest.journo Insta: https://www.instagram.com/michaelwestjourno/
articles.author: Michael West

articles.headline: Bad apples or bad orchard? KPMG Australia fails ethics test
articles.description: It’s a good thing engineers didn’t have the professional standards of some of today’s accountants when the Sydney Harbour Bridge went up, or we might be driving straight into the water.
articles.author: Michael West

articles.headline: Billionaire Tuckshop: plutocrats don’t just steal the show. They steal our trust
articles.description: The Greens have written to new Senate President Slade to stop Australia's Parliament House being used to gouge money from billionaires and corporations. Michael West reports on Treasurer Josh Frydenberg's gala fundraiser in the Great Hall.
articles.author: Michael West

articles.headline: LNP Donors are just giving freely…. wink.
articles.description: The Story: https://www.michaelwest.com.au/billionaire-tuckshop-plutocrats-dont-just-steal-the-show-they-steal-our-trust/ Patreon: https://www.patreon.com/TheWestReport Merch: https://lonelykidsclub.com/new/michael+west Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/michaelwest.journo Insta: https://www.instagram.com/michaelwestjourno/
articles.author: Michael West

articles.headline: Documents reveal Dominic Perrottet, Paul Toole lobbied for Catholic control of $5bn cemeteries
articles.description: Documents obtained by Michael West Media reveal NSW Premier Dominic Perrottet and his deputy Paul Toole actively supported attempts to hand over hundreds of millions of dollars in Sydney’s cemetery assets and funds to a company controlled by the Catholic Church between 2017 and 2020.
articles.author: Callum Foote

articles.headline: The Printer and the Shredder: Reserve Bank has neat trick to tackle rising interest rates
articles.description: Rates went ballistic this week but the Reserve Bank has a secret weapon for tackling inflation. But who would have thought it would entail Dan Andrews paying Josh Frydenberg?
articles.author: Michael West

articles.headline: HAPPY 90TH BIRTHDAY KING RUPERT!
articles.description: Even though ol’ Rupert’s birthday was back in march, he’s hosting his 90th celebration in New York today so we...
articles.author: Michael West

articles.headline: APM promoters exit jobless profits in ASX float, turn to profiteering from disabled
articles.description: The impending $972m float of employment services provider APM is a classic case of foreign financiers dumping their stock into the laps of unwitting sharemarket investors. Callum Foote, Stephanie Tran and Michael West report on a bonanza for middle-people
articles.author: Callum Foote

articles.headline: Dodgicel: Andy Penn given more billions, this time to beat China to a telco takeover
articles.description: Why the blazes was Telstra slotted $1.6bn by the government to buy Digicell and annoy the Chinese, and how is it Telstra shares slumped by one-third during the bull market when they cooly took $100bn in public money? Kim Wingerei checks on the charmed existence of chief executive Andy Penn
articles.author: Kim Wingerei

articles.headline: From backstreets of Glasgow, our man in a car’s eye on COP26
articles.description: Sir Maxwell MacLeod isn't sitting around hurling bricks at the television as world leaders meeting at the climate summit in Glasgow fail to come up with a plan to save the planet. He is reporting the event onsite for MWM, his way.
articles.author: Sir Maxwell MacLeod

articles.headline: Blessed are the Litigants: Catholic backlash over cemeteries grab
articles.description: A PR man for Catholic Church has threatened Michael West Media with legal action for coverage of the battle for control of Sydney's cemeteries. Callum Foote evaluates the claims of the Catholic Metropolitan Cemeteries Trust and its crisis consultants
articles.author: Callum Foote

articles.headline: Regional Grants: a bumper crop of rorts
articles.description: The Morrison government’s country contingent knows how to count. If there’s a dollar to dole out to the regions, they will ensure that 80 cents of it goes to the people they won over or want to win over.
articles.author: Jommy Tee

articles.headline: A bumper crop of rorts
articles.description: The Story: https://www.michaelwest.com.au/regional-grants-rorts-bbrf/ Follow Jommy on twitter: https://twitter.com/jommy_tee Patreon: https://www.patreon.com/TheWestReport Merch: https://lonelykidsclub.com/new/michael+west Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/michaelwest.journo Insta: https://www.instagram.com/michaelwestjourno/
articles.author: Michael West

articles.headline: Social media: time to turn around the weapons
articles.description: For all the benefits wrought by the information revolution, social media has become a tool of dictators. Its profit-driven, surveillance-based business model favours those with deep pockets and deadly motives. In the first of two articles, cybersecurity expert and human rights activist Manal al-Sharif suggests way to invent the digital world for the better.
articles.author: Manal al-Sharif

articles.headline: Using water wisely, Barnaby? Or another dicey deal in the pipeline?
articles.description: Barnaby Joyce has dipped into a water infrastructure fund to grant $5 million to a company well-connected with Tasmania’s Liberal Party elite so they can build a 7km pipeline under Hobart’s Derwent River to water a newly planned, privately owned golf course, reports Callum Foote.
articles.author: Callum Foote

articles.headline: Chasing the gold, we trade away rights of the old
articles.description: Australia has signed on to one of the world's biggest ever trade deals with most of the Asia-Pacific. We negotiated a suite a exemptions to look after our social compact, but guess who was sacrificed?  Dr Sarah Russell reports.
articles.author: Dr Sarah Russell

articles.headline: Necropolis Now: crunch time for Catholic cemetery bid
articles.description: The decision of whether to hand control over Sydney’s most valuable cemeteries to the Catholic Church may be made tomorrow. Callum Foote reports.
articles.author: Callum Foote

articles.headline: Addicted to privatisation, addicted to failure
articles.description: The takeover bid for Sydney Airport all but done, a takeover frenzy grips the sharemarket. Investors, foreign and local, know Australian governments are an easy touch, that they allow their citizens to be pillaged, that some of them actually believe the bankers' myth that privatisation means efficiency. Michael West reports
articles.author: Michael West

articles.headline: We’re being threatened AGAIN!
articles.description: The Story: https://www.michaelwest.com.au/blessed-are-the-litigants-catholic-backlash-over-cemeteries-grab/ Necropolis Now: crunch time for Catholic cemetery bid Patreon: https://www.patreon.com/TheWestReport Merch: https://lonelykidsclub.com/new/michael+west Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/michaelwest.journo Insta: https://www.instagram.com/michaelwestjourno/
articles.author: Michael West

articles.headline: Coal baron the frontrunner as Coalition finally unfurls climate technology which exists
articles.description: Coal baron and Liberal donor Trevor St Baker is a ripe candidate for Scott Morrison's electric vehicles (EVs) subsidies. Callum Foote reports on the commendable materialisation of a Coalition climate action technology which actually exists.
articles.author: Callum Foote

articles.headline: Wood for the Trees: rush to green hydrogen masks mammoth plans to wood-chip the forests
articles.description: Is green hydrogen yet another spin with catastrophic consequences for the environment? Sue Arnold looks behind the greenwash to find wide-scale plans for logging for wood-chips
articles.author: Suzanne Arnold

articles.headline: Regional grants: the pork is succulent in super-safe seats
articles.description: The electorates of Coalition ministers Mark Coulton and David Littleproud have benefited  hugely from some juggling of the funding rul
articles.author: Jommy Tee

articles.headline: Unquiet graves: Muslims add to criticism over the great cemetery takeover
articles.description: Sydney's Muslims are considering a complaint to ICAC over Premier Dominic Perrottet's apparent favouritism towards the Catholic Church’s attempted takeover of NSW cemeteries, reports Callum Foote.
articles.author: Callum Foote

articles.headline: Gouging Government: how a billion-dollar job agency dudded taxpayers, then the super funds
articles.description: Sharemarket pirates have cashed in on Australia’s unemployed. They are targeting the disabled and the elderly next. Callum Foote and Michael West investigate the monumental fee gouge by freshly floated APM and other job agencies
articles.author: Michael West

articles.headline: It’s none of our business what happened to Morrison at Tourism Australia. Just ask ‘Scott’
articles.description: New evidence shows the Prime Minister’s Office (PMO) interfered in denying a Freedom of Information (FOI) request by Michael West Media (MWM) into Scott Morrison’s sacking from Tourism Australia in 2006
articles.author: Jommy Tee

articles.headline: ‘Obnoxious fabrication’: Paul Keating blasts Herald and Age coverage of his China views
articles.description: Former prime minister Paul Keating's speech last week on Australia-China relations has generated wide debate. Last Saturday his views were critiqued by Peter Hartcher in The Sydney Morning Herald and The Age. His reply to that article was rejected by those newspapers. This is an edited version of the rejected article.
articles.author: Paul Keating

articles.headline: Glasgow kissoff: our man in a car is driven to tears
articles.description: With the hype removed and the political posturing ignored, was COP 26 a success?  And what were they all saying about Australia?
articles.author: Sir Maxwell MacLeod

articles.headline: He never lies or answers FOI’s
articles.description: The Story: https://www.michaelwest.com.au/its-none-of-our-business-what-happened-to-morrison-at-tourism-australia-just-ask-scott/ Where the bloody hell is it? Did Scott Morrison lie about the report that saved his bacon...
articles.author: Michael West

articles.headline: Defamation disaster: bid to muzzle journalists, teachers, no more than a lawyers’ fee-fest
articles.description: With a small army of lawyers having already gouged hundreds of thousands of dollars in fees, Canberra law firm Meyer Vandenberg continues to stand over independent media with defamation threats, writes Michael West.
articles.author: Michael West

articles.headline: Profits of punishment: the big business of Australia’s private prisons
articles.description: Multinational prison contractors reap billion-dollar government contracts with soaring profits throughout the pandemic while inmates and their loved ones languish through uncertainty, lockdowns and COVID-19 outbreaks. An investigation by Stephanie Tran into Australia's privatised prisons.
articles.author: Stephanie Tran

articles.headline: When governments defy the people: the authoritarian blueprint for oppression
articles.description: Inspired by the Arab Spring, Manal al-Sharif used social media to start and lead movements. In the second of two articles, the Saudi-born cybersecurity expert and human rights activist examines how her home country uses social media to crush dissent. She explains how digital rights and human rights are inextricably intertwined, and how the absence of the former is the death knell of the latter.
articles.author: Manal al-Sharif

articles.headline: Revealed: Rupert Murdoch’s crack team of Liberal Party fundraisers
articles.description: News Corp columnists have continued to beat the bushes for the Coalition at fundraising events, the latest batch of political donations...
articles.author: Stephanie Tran

articles.headline: Recovery, resilience and a riddle or three: Morrison’s disaster-fighting behemoth
articles.description: Scott Morrison's National Recovery and Resilience Agency was formed in May to oversee an eye-watering $8 billion in disaster relief funds. Is it doing the job was intended to do? Callum Foote investigates the Prime Minister’s secrecy-loving new agency
articles.author: Callum Foote

articles.headline: MWM PODCAST – David McBride
articles.description: Support David here: https://www.gofundme.com/f/50-years-in-jail-for-whistleblowing-on-the-adf?utm_source=customer&utm_medium=copy_link_all&utm_campaign=p_cp+share-sheet Follow David on twitter: https://twitter.com/MurdochCadell Patreon: https://www.patreon.com/TheWestReport Merch: https://lonelykidsclub.com/new/michael+west Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/michaelwest.journo Insta: https://www.instagram.com/michaelwestjourno/ #AfghanFiles
articles.author: Michael West

articles.headline: Wasted JobKeeper could have funded JobSeeker raise for five years
articles.description: Australia's Jobseeker rate is second lowest in the OECD. The $40 billion wasted through JobKeeper could have funded a raise for over 5 years.
articles.author: Callum Foote

articles.headline: Amended dignity: our elders denied their human rights again
articles.description: It will be up to the Senate to hold the line against one of the Morrison government's most alarming sleights of hand regarding the welfare of Australia's elderly. Sarah Russell investigates.
articles.author: Dr Sarah Russell

articles.headline: Scott Morrison’s bureaucracy bloat: cost of government soars to $100 billion
articles.description: In spite of the Liberal party's small-government rhetoric, Prime Minister Scott Morrison is overseeing the most expensive government in recent memory with departmental expenses outstripping both tax revenue and Australia's GDP; and dwarfing Labor. Callum Foote investigates
articles.author: Callum Foote

articles.headline: Pfizer refuses to share vaccine knowledge as it announces $US36 billion in vaccine revenue
articles.description: While rich countries like Australia are reaching 80% or more double vaccination rates, less than 5% of people in many low income countries have received COVID-19 vaccines. Millions are dying while new more infectious strains of the virus develop
articles.author: Patricia Ranald

articles.headline: The hidden world of power and influence: donors pay top dollar for a seat at Ministers’ table
articles.description: “We don’t live in a democracy anymore. We live in a plutocracy. The Australian political system is a wholly owned subsidiary of big corporations.” An investigation reveals donors paying top dollar at political fundraising events for exclusive access to ministers
articles.author: Stephanie Tran

articles.headline: Suffering in comparison: Australia’s economic outcomes the worst in 60 years
articles.description: The Covid pandemic has affected several industries and data sets. But it does not explain Australia falling down the global tables on economic performance.
articles.author: Alan Austin

articles.headline: JoshKeeper: Patrick slams “piss weak” Senate body in Tax Commissioner contempt row over JobKeeper secrecy
articles.description: Australia's slide into corporatocracy continues apace. Executives of oil giant Exxon flat out lied about their tax havens to a senate inquiry and were not sanctioned. Not even a slap on the wrist. Now the senate's Privileges Committee has allowed the Tax Commissioner to thumb his nose at the Senate by by refusing to release JobKeeper data.
articles.author: Callum Foote
